page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY BALBY
page.content: Balby is a small dormitory suburb of Doncaster. It is approximately 1.5 miles from the town centre. Balby is an ancient homestead since it is mentioned in the original Domesday Book as Balbeii. It is said that in the 17th century the Quaker George Fox held meetings here finding the people more tolerant than those of Warmsworth where he was stoned. There is little local industry though some disused quarries indicate that limestone was quarreid here in the past. Most people work in Doncaster carried there by an excellent bus service. Most shopping is done there. In Balby a modern sewage disposal unit has been built to serve Hexthorpe, Balby and Alverley. Housing in Balby is divided between private and council owned.
